means: 傻笑，假笑( simper的现在分词 )

sentence.Network_cn: 扭捏作态、嘻嘻傻笑的女孩子

sentence.Network_en: Lydgate's conceit was of the arrogant sort, never simpering , never impertinent.
sentence.Network_cn: 利德盖特的自负是一种傲气, 它从不嗤笑, 从不盛气凌人.

sentence.Network_en: Then there is spring, the season for simpering adolescents , May flies and impressionable poetasters.
sentence.Network_cn: 再说春天吧.那是乐呵呵的小青年, 多愁善感的三流诗人和蜉蝣的季节.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 以g结尾的英语英文单词 ... sidesplitting 令人捧腹大笑的 simpering 傻笑的 singing 唱歌.
Peter Quince at... ... simpering 痴笑的。 The fitful tracing of a portal 断断续续地追溯一扇门，指美感在心灵中停留的短暂。.
...W·斯塔尔(Kenneth W. Starr)那样皮笑肉不笑(simpering)、优柔寡断的法西斯胆小鬼(shilly-shallying fascist milquetoas)来领导，斯.

entry.def: When someone simpers, they smile in a rather silly way.

example.ex: The maid lowered her chin and simpered.

auth_sentence.content: We are John Wayne to his simpering town sheriff.
auth_sentence.res_content: We are John Wayne to his simpering town sheriff.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We are John Wayne to his simpering town sheriff.

auth_sentence.content: I don't recall ever simpering about anything.

auth_sentence.content: It's nearly impossible to do without some simpering sentimentality.
